headline: CNN Newsroom
subHeadline: Officials Provide Update on New Orleans Attack Investigation. Aired 11:30a-12p ET

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Governor, this is for you and the assistant director.The message has really changed since yesterday. Yesterday, the FBI said that people should be vigilant, that he did not act alone, that he likely had help. And now you're coming out the very next day and saying he was a lone wolf, everything is safe, the game moves on, everybody, have a good time. How can you be so sure just 12 hours later?

utterances.speaker: RAIA
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Governor.And to echo exactly, I think the governor put it, put it eloquently as could be said. In a lot of these instances -- I also had the opportunity to deploy to BOSBOMB. And I will tell you, this is almost carbon copy to BOSBOMB as far as the inaccurate reporting that comes up. And what the governor said is, we want to be transparent with the public. Years of the FBI not being transparent -- we're being as transparent as we possibly can. Unfortunately, as we're being transparent, unfortunately, for that, there is some information that we have to go back and we correct. And, in this particular incident, you heard the resources that we brought, that the other state and locals have brought. We have had 24 hours now to go through media, to go through phones, to interview people, to analyze those videos, analyze other databases. And after all of that, there's been hundreds and hundreds of leads done just in 24 hours. We're confident at this point that there is no accomplices. And I will give you an idea of how that information -- sometimes, a lot of the early reports came out that there were people that -- extra people that were setting the coolers down, right? It turns out those were just patrons on the street that were looking -- looking inside the coolers, right? Well, we didn't know that at first. We had to kind of track all that down and put that to rest. So that's just an example of one of the pieces of information, but there were other pieces of information that after we got our feet under us a little bit and on the ground here, we were able to put together a much more accurate picture of the subject and his attention. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: The updated death toll, I just wanted to double-check, 14, not 15?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: RAIA
utterances.sentences: Yes, 14, and then the shooter himself would be 15 total, to include the shooter.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: The IEDs. The IEDs. Were the IEDs pipe bombs? And have you discovered a remote dead detonator anywhere?And when you said that he plant -- you have surveillance footage of the suspect planting those IEDS. What time, roughly, were they planted?

utterances.speaker: RAIA
utterances.sentences: Yes, those -- roughly a couple of hours. I don't have the exact times in front of me, a couple hours prior to the attack, probably after midnight, after midnight. I want to say 1

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: So, he left the area and came back?

utterances.speaker: RAIA
utterances.sentences: Correct. That's our assumption now. I mean, we still have a lot to work through. We're getting more surveillance video and everything else, but that's the assumption.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Were there sweeps being done on Bourbon Street? Would there have been canines out on New Year's Eve? Would there have been bomb sweeps done...(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: LANDRY
utterances.sentences: Look, I think...

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: ... regular precautions?

utterances.speaker: LANDRY
utterances.sentences: Let me just say this. And either Joe or Rob will correct me.Look, a bomb dog doesn't operate like a drug dog, right? They -- on Bourbon Street, there's a lot of senses, right, a lot of smells. I don't think you can run a bomb dog down Bourbon Street with thousands of people there and be able to sniff out a bomb. What we have been doing, what they have been doing, it's certainly a complete sweep of the Quarter because of the limited amount of traffic that's been out there. Let me just say this. I think this may help. It would be my hope that, as some additional time goes through, maybe closer to maybe to the beginning of next week, we will -- if we have got it to what extent buttoned up as we could, I would work with the FBI and the city and maybe we can come up with a timeline to be able to get you those information, kind of walk everyone through from day one through. I think it is, it's extremely premature, and you're really putting us on some speculative grounds to ask some of those questions, because, again, it's only been 24 hours. I mean, can you imagine how far we have come in 24 hours? (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: LANDRY
utterances.sentences: Hold on, hold on, hold on. Well, we will go one at a time.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: (OFF-MIKE) New Year's Eve. Were temporary bollards being brought in to block off the street, and why weren't those used on New Year's Eve?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We have time for two more questions.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Can you speak to the Mandeville scene?

utterances.speaker: LANDRY
utterances.sentences: And then we will go to you.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: And some neighbors at that site told us they smelled smoke early in the morning. Was there a fire there, any kind of burning happening?

utterances.speaker: RAIA
utterances.sentences: Yes, great...

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Do you still believe that fire happened after the suspect was killed?

utterances.speaker: LANDRY
utterances.sentences: You want to...

utterances.speaker: RAIA
utterances.sentences: That's correct.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: RAIA
utterances.sentences: Yes, I will move to ATF. I do want to address the suicide vest question. I want to kill that one right away. There was no evidence that the subject was wearing a suicide vest at all.So I will turn the Mandeville stuff over to ATF.

utterances.speaker: JACKSON
utterances.sentences: As to the fire at the Mandeville scene, so our working theory now is that the fire started after Jabbar was already deceased. There's a lot of different ways that could happen. You could have different time devices. You could have a long cord that extended that time.You could also have pressure cookers that were put on top of the stove filled with gasoline, and then it went off. There's a lot of different ways to do it, but that is why our ATF National Response Team is here to answer those questions and get that investigative lead back to our team. So, more to come on that. We're still processing that scene. We're out there right now. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: What do we understand about he became radicalized over all of this time? What brought him to Bourbon Street, do we understand? Was there any international traveling involved? What led him down this path to this sort of radicalization?

utterances.speaker: RAIA
utterances.sentences: Sure, a lot of questions we're still asking ourselves.We know that he specifically picked out Bourbon Street. Not quite sure why. I think one can assume that it was lots of people, New Year's Eve, with a target for an attack. That's the stuff in the coming days as far as that path to radicalization that we're really going to be digging into and making a priority of. So what I can tell you right now is that he was 100 percent inspired by ISIS, and so we're digging through more of the social media, more interviews, working with some of our other partners to ascertain just how -- to ascertain a little bit more about that connection. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: LANDRY
utterances.sentences: Whoa. Whoa. We're going to do one more. Kate? Kate?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Right there. You have had your hand up for a while.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Thank you. I appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: LANDRY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: It's actually for Special Agent Raia.Sir...

utterances.speaker: LANDRY
utterances.sentences: I prefer those, I would tell you.(LAUGHTER) QUESTION:  In order to reassure people, would you be able to explain the analysis and evidence that has led to this most recent understanding that he was a lone actor and that there is, at this point, at least from your understanding, no further danger to the public?

utterances.speaker: RAIA
utterances.sentences: Sure. Sure.I think a lot of that, multiple interviews, the hundreds, hundreds of interviews that we have conducted so far, the social media review that we have done of his accounts, the five -- what we -- by my count now, the five devices we have, the three cell phones and the two laptops, been able to initially triage or go through that. And there is just nothing to indicate through call records, through anything on those devices, through interviews, through anything in our systems, that he was aided in this attack by anybody. And, again, I have to caveat, like the governor said, it's just 24 hours into it, and that could change. But, right now, we have got a much better picture and much more confidence on what we were dealing with than we were just 24 hours ago. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: LANDRY
utterances.sentences: All right, look, thank you all. Thank you all so very much.Again, again, again, we are going to try to get you all as much information as possible, so any additional information will be put out through press releases. Thank you so very much.

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Mayor...

utterances.speaker: PHIL MATTINGLY, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: You have been watching the latest update from local and federal officials in the wake of the New Year's morning attack on Bourbon Street in New Orleans, an attack that left 14 individuals dead, more than 30 individuals hurt.We now know, in some significant developments, that what was concerning a lot of officials, both federal and local yesterday, is no longer the case in terms of the belief that there is no other individual involved, in the plot for this attack, the fact that they believe at this point he acted alone. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: RAIA
utterances.sentences: This was an act of terrorism. It was premeditated and an evil act.We do not assess at this point that anyone else involved in this attack -- is involved in this attack, except for Shamsud-Din Jabbar, the subject you have already been briefed on. (END VIDEO CLIP)
